natural solution: We have \[0.\overline{4} = \frac{4}{10} + \frac{4}{100} + \frac{4}{1000} + \cdots.\]This infinite geometric series has first term $4/10=2/5$ and common ratio $1/10$, so we have \[0.\overline{4} = \frac{2/5}{1-1/10} = \boxed{\frac{4}{9}}.\]

shows  "x = 0.4 + 0.04 * (\<Sum>n. (1/100) ^ n)"

 We have \[0.\overline{4} = \frac{4}{10} + \frac{4}{100} + \frac{4}{1000} + \cdots.\]This infinite geometric series has first term $4/10=2/5$ and common ratio $1/10$, so we have \[0.\overline{4} = \frac{2/5}{1-1/10} = \boxed{\frac{4}{9}}.\]
 *)

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 4 / 9"
shows  "x = 0.4 + 0.04 * (\<Sum>n. (1/100) ^ n)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
